name: Make-Ahead Mustardy Quinoa With Sausage, Potato, and Tarragon
description: This week's lunchbox was borne out of a desire to make and eat my favorite potato salad for lunch, followed by the begrudging conclusion that just potato salad does not a responsible lunch make. So I added some things—handfuls of arugula and a base of black quinoa—to turn a side dish craving into a full-fledged meal.
recipeIngredient: 1 pound purple or white potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch dice
1 large spicy or sweet pork sausage, removed from casings and crumbled

recipeInstructions.text: Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Place potatoes in pot; cover with cold water by 1 inch and sprinkle liberally with salt. Bring to a boil, and boil under tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, sauté sausage over medium-low heat until crisp and fat is rendered. Drain on paper towels; reserve rendered fat.

Whisk together oil, mustard, tarragon, 1/8 teaspoon salt and reserved fat. Gently mix 1 tablespoon dressing into potatoes while still warm. Fold potatoes, sausage and arugula into quinoa, and toss gently with remaining dressing. Serve immediately, or refrigerate until ready to eat. Reheat or enjoy at room temperature.
